tool_description: Residue-level classification is concerned with categorizing individual amino acids within a protein sequence. This category includes secondary structure prediction, where the aim is to determine the local 3D structure of the protein segments; binding site prediction, which identifies specific amino acids involved in binding interactions; and active site prediction, which pinpoints the amino acids responsible for the protein's enzymatic activity.

required_parameters.name: dataset
required_parameters.description: Training dataset of saprot_residue_classification model. Dataset should be a .csv file with three required columns: sequence, label and stage

required_parameters.name: base_model
required_parameters.description: Base model for saprot_protein_classification model. Base model should be one of (1) SaProt_35M (2) SaProt_650M

optional_parameters.name: batch_size
optional_parameters.description: batch_size depends on the number of training samples. Adaptive (default choice) refers to automatic batch size according to your data size. If your training data set is large enough, you can use 32, 64, 128, 256, ..., others can be set to 8, 4, 2.

optional_parameters.name: max_epoch
optional_parameters.description: max_epochs refers to the maximum number of training iterations. A larger value needs more training time. The best model will be saved after each iteration. You can adjust max_epochs to control training duration.

optional_parameters.name: learning_rate
optional_parameters.description: learning_rate affects the convergence speed of the model. Through experimentation, we have found that 5.0e-4 is a good default value for base model Official pretrained SaProt (650M) and 1.0e-3 for Official pretrained SaProt (35M).

return_values.name: status
return_values.description: Whether the model is successfully trained or not
